result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad W Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Consecutive to: To Any Current Sentence

miscConds.notes: 03-23-2015:  Restitution in the amount of $13,875.73:  $8,051.52 to Travelers Insurance and $5,824.21 to Spring Gardens.  Court finds the defendant has the ability to pay restitution. As a Condition of Probation payment to be at the rate rate of $100.00 per month starting 05-15-2015.

Costs and Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $60.00 per month starting 06-01-2015.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

AS OF 9/21/2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero. Civil judgment amount now is $16,545.12
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Obtain a valid driver's license within First 90 days of Probation
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
No contact with Co-Defendant.
No contact with Spring Garden Landscaping or any of it's employees.

Sentencing hearing on February 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Chad W Bishop in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court is concerned with a no contest plea and will not accept.  Defense agrees to enter guilty plea.  

Plea Colloquy. Court notes it is difficult to proceed for reasons stated on the record.  Additional statements by Atty. Bugenhagen.  Court will withdraw it's consent to the amended information and strike the plea.  Court takes recess for the defense to speak.  Case recalled at 2:29.  Atty. Bugenhagen states his client wishes to proceed with guilty pleas to the amended information.

Plea Colloquy.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Defense requests new date for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
